lines.text: Virgin at twenty. I was a living anachronism, a real creep!
I don't like this business of writing about your childhood, dragging your parents through the mud. I don't know much, but one thing I do know - if you use art to settle accounts, it's no longer art.
Oh, my poor breasts. If I have a child, I won't breast-feed him.
Well, don't look at me. He'll have to fend for himself.
I still love you. But I'd rather not see you anymore.
You're my sister, you're my daughter, you're my mother.
I would have liked to be your wife.
